Author: PloddingAboot

Comment: First: You’d need 7 million troops to effectively occupy the United States (military wisdom is 20 soldiers per 1,000 civilians) even including every single troop that we have ALONG with every cop, being generous that is 3.2 million, so not even half. Throw in that USA is HUGE, the population is armed and generally unaccustomed to harsh authoritarian rule you cannot effectively declare martial law across the United States. This isnt even getting into supply, support, resistance, defection, insubordination etc etc etc.  Second: Martial Law in the United States when it has been declared in areas has always only been to enforce civilian law. Demanding soldiers to start treating their countrymen like insurgents and occupied enemies is likely a recipe for mutiny and disaster.  I’m not saying things cant get bad, but getting worked up and sapping energy on a scenario that is so unlikely is grossly unproductive.
